citation.article-title: Description of Pseudaminobacter gen. nov. with two new species, Pseudaminobacter salicylatoxidans sp. nov. and Pseudaminobacter defluvii sp. nov.

p.s: Pseudaminobacter (Pseud.ami.no.bac.ter. Gr. adj. pseudos false; M.L. Aminobacter generic name of a bacterium, false aminobacters)
Gram-negative, rod-shaped cells, 1-2 μm long by 0.5-0-8 μm wide, with rounded ends.
The major polyamines are spermidine, sym-homospermidine and putrescine.
The overall polar lipid pattern was characterized by nearly the same amounts of the polar lipids PC, PC, PDE, PME, PE and DPG.
The cellular fatty acids include a large amount of straight-chain 18:1 acid.
The hydroxy acids include the hydroxylated fatty acid 15:Oiso 3-OH.
Colonies are circular, entire, slightly convex and smooth, glistening and pale beige on nutrient agar at 25 °C.
Growth occurs on nutrient agar (Oxoid), Caso agar, R2A agar (Oxoid) and TSB agar (BBL).
Several organic compounds can be used as sole source of carbon (Table 1).
The G + C contents of the DNAs are 62.9-63.9 mol% (as determined by HPLC).
Phylogenetically, the genus is a member of the α-subclass of the Proteobacteria.
The type species is Pseudaminobacter salicylatoxidans.
At the molecular level, the genus can be recognized by 16s rRNA sequences and fatty acid profiles (Table 3).
